Dear Ms. Klinski:
Attached is the Special Investigation Report for the above referenced facility. Due to the
violations identified in the report, a written corrective action plan is required. The
corrective action plan is due 15 days from the date of this letter and must include the
following:
 How compliance with each rule will be achieved.
 Who is directly responsible for implementing the corrective action for each
violation.
 Specific time frames for each violation as to when the correction will be
completed or implemented.
 For repeat violations, why the prior corrective action plan did not achieve
compliance.
 Indicate how continuing compliance will be maintained once compliance is
achieved.
 Be signed and dated.
A second provisional license is recommended. If you do not contest the issuance of a
provisional license, you must indicate so in writing on the attached document. If you
contest the issuance of a provisional license, you must notify this office in writing and an
administrative hearing will be scheduled. Even if you contest the issuance of a provisional
license, you must still submit an acceptable corrective action plan.
If you desire technical assistance in addressing these issues, please feel free to contact
me. In any event, the corrective action plan is due within 15 days.
Please note that violations of any licensing rules are also violations of the MISEP and
your contract.

Please review the enclosed documentation for accuracy and contact me with any
questions. In the event that I am not available and you need to speak to someone
immediately, please contact the area manager at (616) 552-3662.
Sincerely,

ALLEGATION:
A youth was able to get into his peer’s locked bedroom and sexually assault him.
INVESTIGATION:
A complaint received on 3/29/21 stated on 3/28/21, around 1:40am, Youth B jimmied
the lock to Youth A's room and entered without being noticed by staff. Youth B then
began to touch Youth A inappropriately as Youth A told Youth B to stop. Youth B
sucked Youth A's penis, licked Youth A's buttocks and anally penetrated Youth A.
Youth A was shaking uncontrollably and felt pain in his rectum. Youth B then
instructed Youth A to sit up on the bed and Youth B sat on Youth A's erect penis and
moved up and down until Youth A ejaculated inside Youth B.
The incident lasted no longer than 15 minutes, and during this time the on-duty staff,
Staff 1, and the on-duty supervisor were on another wing of the facility making their
rounds. Youth B admitted to sneaking into Youth A's room but denies any sexual
interaction. There are video cameras in the facility facing Youth A's room, but the
cameras did not catch Youth B entering or leaving the room. Youth A was
transported to the hospital for an exam and when he is discharged, Youth A will be
placed on a quarantine unit for 14 days, so he will not have any contact with Youth
B.
There have been previous allegations involving Youth A and Youth B, but nothing
has ever been substantiated. The Lincoln Center staff have been aware that the
bedroom locks can be easily manipulated by the residents.
Facility History: A review of the facility’s previous investigations found that the
facility is on a 1st Provisional license due to staffing and inappropriate restraint
positioning. Special Investigation 2021C0219026 involved Youth A and Youth B
engaging in sexual acts with each other. No violations were found. In Special
Investigation 2021C0108010 the facility was found in violation because a youth was
able to enter another youth’s bedroom and assault him. A Corrective Action Plan
dated 12/22/20 stated the facility would move youth who were in bedrooms with non-
working locks to rooms with working locks.
Youth A Case File: Youth A is 19 years old. While at the facility Youth A has
engaged in sexual acts with other youth. He has been found to groom peers. During
Special Investigation 2021C0219026 it was reported that Youth A coerced Youth B
into multiple sexual encounters. Youth A denied the allegation that force was used.
He did admit the sexual acts were consensual. The report stated the facility was
ensuring heightened supervision for Youth A. Another investigation found that Youth
A had touched another youth, not Youth B. Youth A has charges of Criminal Sexual
Conduct (CSC) 1st and 3rd degree.

Youth B Case File: Youth B is 17 years old. He has been charged with CSC 4th

Youth B is physically assaultive to both staff and peers.
Youth A’s Worker: She has been working with Youth A for 4 years. He is 19 years

allegations at the facility and he has been moved to different Pods due to those

Program Director: An e-mail was sent to the Program Director on 3/30/21. He
reported that Youth A was in quarantine and could only be interviewed via Zoom. He
also stated that the cameras did not record when Youth B snuck into Youth A’s
bedroom.
Incident Report: The incident report was provided by the Director on 3/30/21. It

his bedroom door lock, entered his room, and sexually assaulted Youth A. Youth A’s
written statement was included.
The statement indicated that Youth A was asleep when he was woken up by Youth
B. He was scared and too frightened to call for staff. He remembered Youth B
kissing him as he woke up or he whispered Youth A’s name while shaking his
shoulder. He did not recall which. Youth A said he remembered Youth B turning him

then said it was Youth A’s turn and told Youth A to turn around while Youth B licked
Youth A’s butt. Youth A could not remember how many times Youth B penetrated
him, but it was on and off. Youth A turned around and Youth B sucked his penis.
Youth A said he then sat up and felt pain in his rectum. Youth B then turned around

The incident report from staff stated Youth A was immediately taken to another pod.
He was then transported to the hospital for an exam.
Police: The police department was contacted, and it was reported that the detective
had three investigations at the facility involving Youth A.
Youth B Interview: Youth B was interviewed at the facility on 4/1/21. He reported
the day of the incident Youth A had been grooming him. Youth A was winking at

Youth A had previously flashed Youth B. The night before the incident another youth

bedrooms earlier that day.
Youth B reported that Staff 1 was in the control room and could see the bedrooms

B reported he feels safe now that he is separated from Youth A.
Staff 1 Interview: Staff 1 was interviewed at the facility on 4/1/21. He stated he has
been at the facility for seven years and he always works at night. On the night of the
incident he came in around 10:30pm. Youth B was out of his room and gave some
excuses as to why he did not want to go back in his room. Another staff tried to get

order to complete paperwork over there. At about 1:35am Staff 1 needed to get up

control room he saw Youth B sitting at the door by the laundry room. He was not in
Youth A's bedroom. Staff 1 closed Youth A's bedroom door. Youth A jumped up and
said that Youth B raped him.
Staff 1 reported he was aware the doors could be opened by the youth. He reported

would then slide a piece of cardboard between the door and the frame to get the
door open. Youth A told Staff 1 that he was scared and this is why he did not call

out. The supervisor questioned both of the boys and placed Youth A on Pod C.

The night of the incident Staff 1 was sleeping. He knew Staff 1 was sleeping

Staff 2: An attempt was made to contact Staff 2 however his phone was not taking

Policy: The facility’s Supervision and Staffing Policy states the following:
 Staff are responsible for the monitoring and supervision of the youth at all
times. Staff may not leave youth unattended for any reason.
 Staff need to maintain continuous line of sight supervision when youth are
outside of their bedroom.
 Staff are to be awake during youth sleeping hours.
Staff 1 Employee File: Staff 1 was hired on 2/16/16. During his time at the facility
he was disciplined four times. Three of those disciplines were due to attendance and
the fourth was due to failing to abide by safety rules and policies. Since 2020 Staff 1
has received nine separate trainings on Supervision of youth.
Pre-exit: A meeting was held with the Program Director and the Chief Administrator
on 5/6/21. They both indicated the problem with the doors was fixed. A company
came out and looked at the locks and repaired some of them. The reason it took so
long was that it took some time to find a local vendor.
The director was informed that the bedroom doors can still be popped open from the
outside. A safety plan will need to be in place to address the doors. The facility's
assigned consultant worked with them to come up with a safety plan.

APPLICABLE RULE
R 400.4109 Program statement.
(1) An institution shall have and follow a current written
program statement which specifically addresses all of the
following:
(c) Policies and procedures pertaining to admission,
care, safety, and supervision, methods for addressing
residents' needs, implementation of treatment plans, and
discharge of residents.
ANALYSIS: All youth reported that Staff 1 sleeps on his overnight shifts.
Staff 1 did not follow the facility’s policies on Supervision which
led to Youth B being able to enter Youth A’s bedroom.
Technical Assistance: The facility should quarantine youth
according to the MDHHS guidelines. Youth should only be
quarantined if they were exposed to someone who is suspected
of having COVID rather than every time they leave the facility.
CONCLUSION: REPEAT VIOLATION ESTABLISHED
This is a repeat violation cited during Special Investigations
2021C0108025, 2020C0219029, 2020C0219019, and
2020C0108070 with CAP’s accepted on 4/22/21, 5/18/20,
5/21/20, and 1/27/21.

APPLICABLE RULE
R 400.4112 Criminal history check, subject to requirements; staff
qualifications
(4) A person with ongoing duties shall have both of the
following:
(a) Ability to perform the duties of the position assigned.
(b) Experience to perform the duties of the position
assigned.
ANALYSIS: Staff 1 indicated he was aware the youth could get into each
other’s bedroom. Youth A and Youth B both have CSC charges
and were already found to have acted out sexually with each
other. Despite this, Staff 1 did not provide adequate supervision
for the youth on the night of the incident which indicates he does
not have the ability and/or the experience to perform the duties
as assigned to him.
CONCLUSION: REPEAT VIOLATION ESTABLISHED
This is a repeat violation cited during Special Investigation
2021C0108004 with a CAP accepted on 12/23/20.
11

APPLICABLE RULE
R 400.4407 Facility and premises maintenance.
(1) A facility and premises shall be maintained in a clean,
comfortable, and safe condition. The facility shall be
located on land that is properly drained.
ANALYSIS: All the youth interviewed indicated they could get into certain
bedrooms when those bedrooms were locked. This incident
occurred on 3/28/21. During a visit to the facility on 5/6/21 the
youth continued to state they could get the doors open. Youth D
was able to demonstrate this on his bedroom door. This was an
issue that was brought up and addressed in a CAP dated
12/22/20. Because the youth can enter each other’s bedrooms
in a secure facility, the facility is found to not be maintained in a
safe condition.
CONCLUSION: REPEAT VIOLATION ESTABLISHED
This is a repeat violation cited during Special Investigation
2021C0108010 with a CAP accepted on 12/23/20.
IV. RECOMMENDATION
Upon acceptance of a Corrective Action Plan, it is recommended that the facility be
issued a 2nd provisional license.
